member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyHttpClient.GetPolicyEvaluationsAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: [Preview API] Retrieves a list of all the policy evaluation statuses for a specific pull request.
member.param: Project ID or project name
A string which uniquely identifies the target of a policy evaluation.

Some policies might determine that they do not apply to a specific pull request. Setting this parameter to true will return evaluation records even for policies which don't apply to this pull request.
The number of policy evaluation records to retrieve.
The number of policy evaluation records to ignore. For example, to retrieve results 101-150, set top to 50 and skip to 100.
The cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyHttpClient.GetPolicyEvaluationsAsync(System.Guid,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration
member.summary: The full policy configuration with settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.CreatedBy
member.summary: A reference to the identity that created the policy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.CreatedDate
member.summary: The date and time when the policy was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.IsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the policy is enabled.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.IsBlocking
member.summary: Indicates whether the policy is blocking.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.IsDeleted
member.summary: Indicates whether the policy has been (soft) deleted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.Settings
member.summary: The policy configuration settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfiguration.Links
member.summary: The links to other objects related to this object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfigurationRef
member.summary: Policy configuration reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfigurationRef.Id
member.summary: The policy configuration ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfigurationRef.Url
member.summary: The URL where the policy configuration can be retrieved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyConfigurationRef.Type
member.summary: The policy configuration type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.VersionedPolicyConfigurationRef
member.summary: A particular revision for a policy configuration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.VersionedPolicyConfigurationRef.Revision
member.summary: The policy configuration revision ID.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord
member.summary: This record encapsulates the current state of a policy as it applies to one specific pull request. Each pull request has a unique PolicyEvaluationRecord for each pull request which the policy applies to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.Configuration
member.summary: Contains all configuration data for the policy which is being evaluated.
member.remarks: This contains policy configuration options for a policy as the policy's display name, policy scope, and settings which vary based on the type of policy.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.ArtifactId
member.summary: A string which uniquely identifies the target of a policy evaluation.
member.remarks: To generate an artifact ID for a pull request, use this template: ``` vstfs:///CodeReview/CodeReviewId/{projectId}/{pullRequestId} ```

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.EvaluationId
member.summary: Guid which uniquely identifies this evaluation record (one policy running on one pull request).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.StartedDate
member.summary: Time when this policy was first evaluated on this pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.CompletedDate
member.summary: Time when this policy finished evaluating on this pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.Status
member.summary: Status of the policy (Running, Approved, Failed, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.Context
member.summary: Internal context data of this policy evaluation.
member.remarks: The contents of this JSON object are internal to the running policy. It may contain things such as a build ID, a digital signature, or any other thing(s) which are needed for the policy to approve or reject a pull request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationRecord.Links
member.summary: Links to other related objects

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus
member.summary: Status of a policy which is running against a specific pull request.
member.remarks: Not all policies make use of every status. For example, policies which are based on reviewers voting do not have a Runnig state. They are generally Queued when no vote has been cast, and then transition to Approved or Rejected depending on the vote.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus.Queued
member.summary: The policy is either queued to run, or is waiting for some event before progressing.
member.remarks: In the case of a build policy, this might represent a build which is in the queue waiting for a build agent. Other examples include a reviewer policy where the reviewer has not yet voted. Once the reviewer votes, the status would transition to either Approved or Rejected as approriate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus.Running
member.summary: The policy is currently running.
member.remarks: Few policies make use of this state; generally a build or release would be involved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus.Approved
member.summary: The policy has been fulfilled for this pull request.
member.remarks: Generally a pull request where all policies are Approved or NotApplicable can be completed and the target branch updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus.Rejected
member.summary: The policy has rejected this pull request.
member.remarks: It should be noted that no policy status is final while a pull request is active. For example, a required reviewer policy might be in Rejected status because the reviewer has voted "Waiting on author". If the reviewer later changes his vote to an approval, the policy status will transition to Approved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus.NotApplicable
member.summary: The policy does not apply to this pull request.
member.remarks: Generally a pull request where all policies are Approved or NotApplicable can be completed and the target branch updated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyEvaluationStatus.Broken
member.summary: The policy has encountered an unexpected error.
member.remarks: This status should not normally occur. It signals that the policy itself has encountered an error or exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyType
member.summary: User-friendly policy type with description (used for querying policy types).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyType.Description
member.summary: Detailed description of the policy type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyType.Links
member.summary: The links to other objects related to this object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyTypeRef
member.summary: Policy type reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyTypeRef.Id
member.summary: The policy type ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyTypeRef.Url
member.summary: The URL where the policy type can be retrieved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Policy.WebApi.PolicyTypeRef.DisplayName
member.summary: Display name of the policy type.
